meanings.definition: To cause someone to lose enthusiasm or hope.
meanings.sent1: Constant criticism can dispirits a person.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected exam dispirits the students.
meanings.sent4: The long wait for the bus dispirits the commuters.
meanings.sent5: The loss in the final game dispirits the team.

meanings.definition: To make someone feel discouraged or disheartened.
meanings.sent1: Receiving a rejection letter dispirits many job seekers.
meanings.sent2: The lack of progress dispirits the team members.
meanings.sent3: The broken elevator dispirits the office workers.
meanings.sent4: The constant delays dispirits the travelers.
meanings.sent5: The failed experiment dispirits the scientists.
